page.title: 02Railway Village, Swindon
page.content: In 1840 three hundred cottages were built by the G.W.R for their workers. These cottages were tiny,with 2 or 3 small bedrooms,a livingroom and a kitchen.There was no bathroom and the toilet was outside in the yard. Food could be cooked on an iron stove heated with coal,and water had to be fetched in.These cottages were modernised in 1980 and provide limited but stylish accommodation.They are a lasting memorial to the G.W.R. {Railway Museum. The museum is housed in what was the G.W.R.barracks,which was accommodation for single men.In 1890 it became a Wesleyan chapel until 1962.Today it houses engines like North Star and City of Truro. There is a huge copper coffee pot in the shape of an engine made for Queen Victoria which produced nasty tasting coffee.
